intro: Verticordia patens, commonly known as the spreading heart-leaved banksia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking, urn-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in heathlands and sandplain areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. Verticordia patens is a popular ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and seasonal flowering.
